Class Universe

java.lang.Object
  Universe

public class Universe
extends java.lang.Object

Class Universe - a universe that is used to contain all the Space_Object objects and allow them to interact with one another via collision and rotation.

Version:
2016.3.10
Author:
Robert Topp & Shaun Porter

Universe

public Universe()
Opens the interface and gives the user the ability to select a universe to run.

Universe

public Universe(java.lang.String name,
                int rightEdge,
                int bottomEdge)
Create a universe with given name and size. To be used in testing

Parameters:
name - The name to give the universe
rightEdge - The maximum x coordinate
bottomEdge - The maximum y coordinate

bounce

checkCollision

public void checkCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Space_Object> objectList)
Used to check for collision between each object inside the universe and give behaviour to each Space_Object depending on their type when collisions occour.

Parameters:
objectList - - Each object in the universe comprised of Space_Objects

compareObjectSpace

boolean compareObjectSpace(Space_Object selectObject,
                           Space_Object compareObject,
                           int selectedObjectRadiusIn,
                           int compareObjectRadiusIn)
Compares the position of two objects to check for collision.

Parameters:
selectObject - the object selected to be collided with
compareObject - the object that will be compared in this collision
selectedObjectRadiusIn - the effective radius of selectedObject
compareObjectRadiusIn - the effective radius of compareObject

runSim

public void runSim(java.util.ArrayList<Space_Object> objectList)
starts the simulation. assigns stars to planets in the order they're visited in the ArrayList

Parameters:
objectList - The objects in a universe to be checked for collision and to run the move or movePlanet method

sameVelocity

boolean sameVelocity(Space_Object spaceObjOne,
                     Space_Object spaceObjTwo)
Used to check if two Space_Objects are moving at the same speed

Parameters:
spaceObjOne - a Space_Object that will be compared to spaceObjTwo in terms of speed
spaceObjTwo - a Space_Object that will be compared to spaceObjOne in terms of speed

suckIntoHole

void suckIntoHole(Space_Object blackHole,
                  Space_Object absorbObject)
Controls the interaction between comets and blackholes when their effective collision areas overlap.

Parameters:
blackHole - the blackhole Space_Object that will attract and destory absorbObject
absorbObject - Space_Object that will be abosrbed into black hole
